channel.title: Marijuana Radio
channel.description: Marijuana Radio is the original stoner radio. This program is inspired by honest thought and injustice. Do you smoke weed? Ganga? Dope? Herb? Pot? Cannabis? If you're a fan of Marijuana, you're a fan of this show. Paul the Producer, a proud stoner, serves up the show with pride in doobage and stoney wit. What is legalization? Is everything about marijuana positive? Some of us are Medical Marijuana patients and some smoke recreationally. New podcasts are posted on Mondays and Fridays. Tune in, get high, sit back and smile!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 2.0 - Rico Colibri, Crystal Guess, DUI talk and 64 versus 70
item.description: Joined by initiative 70 author Rico Colibri with Crystal Guess by his side, make no mistake, this is historic radio. You won't hear a more honest counter culture conversation anywhere this week. We are faced with an epic showdown in Colorado. Factions are deeply divided about the proper path to legalization, and furthermore, what legalization actually is. Who is a fame whore? Who is working to build a career? Who is an activist? Who is a lobbyist? Which is better and why, 64 or 70? There has been no better proposal for legalization put forward that is consistent with the freedoms and liberties that people should have than 70. I implore and beg the big nationals to get behind initiative 70 so that it has a real fighting chance. It's brilliant and this language should set the precedent for future states and their own legalization efforts. I don't expect help from the people who are theoretically in the best position to do so. We must ask why they won't help. We must hold theses institutions responsible if they help to sell out legalization in every state to the highest mogul bidders. I crave the philosophy to pitch this initiative in an undeniable way. Forget all the personal aspects of this radio program and ask yourself what the future should be regarding legalization for Colorado's people. We are fed up. We want real steps, not baby steps, or even worse, no steps at all being passed off as full legalization when it is nothing of the sort. Get ready, because these coming months are going to be some of the most contentious in Colorado's meaningful history with marijuana legalization.
item.itunes:author: Kuzz Media, LLC
item.itunes:keywords: marijuana radio, the circle radio, hip hop, talk radio, comedy, independent

item.title: Marijuana Radio 2.0 - Elise McDonough, Chloe Villano, Miguel Lopez, Boo the Ghost and more...
item.description: Another fun night on tap. Like the old days, the studio was full with probably the biggest group since the show's new beginning. Early on, The Official High Times Cookbook author Elise McDonough came on to tell us about her book. Later on, we were joined by a defiant Chloe Villano who put up valiantly with many shock radio moments. This charming lady dealt gracefully under pressure, enduring Paul the Producer's shocking onslaught. Miguel Lopez came on the mic briefly to tell us how and why he was arrested during the second day of the 420 Rally. Lastly, we talked to comedian Rick Bryan, and had a rapper guest named Boo the Ghost. Next we had a rap freestyle challenge out of the blue. Paul sucked. Boo the Ghost was too shy, Dick Black tried, and Rick probably did the best. How fun.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 2.0 - Mike Cann, Will Foster, and Wayward Bill
item.description: Tonight there was lots of good stuff to hear for both serious listeners and folks who like to listen. The guys recap the 420 weekend and Cannabis Cup. Paul got going telling the story of being ostracized in High School, and comparing it to a similar experience now. Mike Cann from Boston came on to say hello. Later on a very interesting guest named Will Foster joined us to tell us about his experience being sentenced to 96 years in prison for growing marijuana. All in all, this was a pretty darn good show.

item.title: Solo Paul e009 - Temptation, Maturity, Responsibility and Parenthood
item.description: Paul does a personal podcast from home and reflects on the lonely and empty house. No musical intro, just a raw recording. Paul talks about Cannaween being done without him this year, R.I.P Marijuana Radio, and he's not necessarily going because of this unique period having quit smoking marijuana. He tells the quick story of last night's dream, watching Scarface with Al Pacino, the enormous temptation to smoke but his determined resolve. Also how easy it would be to fall into smoking marijuana again, and how it's different from smoking cigarettes. Some benefits of quitting marijuana, how his personality changes when he does it, the desire to grow up, the juvenile nature of excessive use and more.

item.description: Paul flexes his formidable sober brain muscle to go after the inherent hypocrisy of medical marijuana versus recreational. Stick with it because there's solid messaging despite the overboard demeanor.

item.title: Marijuana Radio Goodbye (Tuesday) - W/McKenna, Brent and Paul
item.description: It is with a heavy heart that I announce the end of Marijuana Radio. For one last recording, we say goodbye to our long and loyal listeners. The only thing that could revive it at this moment is a profound development. It has been my pleasure to serve you these last 4 years. Working with Brent and McKenna may likely the best years of my life. It was so gratifying doing the show with them. I thank you both for your loyal service and friendship.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 180 (Tuesday) - Max Montrose and Brittany Miss High Times
item.description: The counter culture craziness begins and ends here every week. Tonight began with the crew discussing the flop known as the Rocky Mountain Cannabis Connection, during which Paul the Producer spent ample time being critical. We were then joined in studio by Max Montrose from Medicinal Marijuana TV. There was no shortage of high energy when Brittany Miss High Times joined us to make things even better. Together we listened to Mel Gibson's angry tirade toward his wife. This show had the high energy in droves. Help us spread the word of Marijuana Radio!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 179 (Tuesday) - MJR Crew
item.description: Enjoy an unorthodox but fun evening. Tonight we rapped with one another about a myriad of topics. Early on we talked about our July 4th weekend. More on tap, Lindsey Lohan is going to jail, Paris Hilton and weed in South Africa, Paul is back on Facebook, and the gulf oil spill. DanK and McKenna tried to get Paul the Producer to smoke during the show, but it did not happen. Hear the vibe that rules every nook and cranny of counter culture. Yeah.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 175 (Tuesday) - Brittany Miss High Times, McKenna Stephens, Scott Greene and Chad Nance!
item.description: Roll it, pack it, and smoke it to this new episode. Tonight Brittany Miss High Times 2010 subbed for McKenna who was in NYC for her own personal good times. Starting out we talked about the oil spill in the gulf. Early on we got to say hi to McKenna. After that, we talked about Paul the Producer deactivating his Facebook page. Later on our buddy Scott Greene from Mile High Norml came on to say hello. If that's not enough, we were then joined in studio by our other friend Chad Nance from Skunk Magazine. It was a fun and memorable episode. Yet we miss McKenna. The foursome with McKenna and Brittany is the best Marijuana Radio that has existed yet.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 174 (Tuesday) - Jeffrey Peterson 420 Comic
item.description: Good times prevailed tonight as we welcomed Jeffrey Peterson, the 420 comic on to say hello, who was also joined by Gary Busey, Matthew McConaughey, and Dr. Phil. Huh? We talked about how the new MMJ Super Prohibition Bill is going to affect some of our friends in the industry. item.title: Marijuana Radio 173 (Tuesday) - Shirley Phelps, Westboro Baptist Church
item.description: Tonight's classic episode may make your head explode. Early on Paul the Producer delivers recounts his weekend attending the Marc Emery rally in Denver. Next up, we spoke to Shirley Phelps from the Westboro Baptist Church. The conversation started out nice and had its climax with McKenna nearly blowing a fuse. LIsten to hear one of our most heated segments ever. Of course the lovely Brittany Miss High Times joined us on the mic, topping off one of the best mixes in radio.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 169 (Tuesday) - Miss High Times Brittany, Tiny Global Marijuana March and more!
item.description: Once again, tonight the good times rolled joints. Early on we heard the most amazing story from McKenna's weekend. Then we talked about the new SUPERProhibition MMJ Bill 1285 being debated by the State Judiciary Committee, during which Paul the Producer went ballistic. Our friend, Miss High Times Brittany stopped in to tell us about her first glorious week. Next up we were visited by our friend Tiny, organizer of the Denver Global Marijuana March. He was accompanied on the mic by our one and only friend Wayward Bill. Brittany came on again at the end to round out one of the best counter culture evenings in counter culture radio history.

item.description: Howdy folks, we had another fun evening. Unfortunately we missed Tommy Chong, but we're gonna keep trying. Early on we got the chance to speak to Brian Vicente from Sensible Colorado about the new ordinance passed by the Denver City Council just the night before. Later on we read some stories of getting busted for the Cheeba Champ contest. Miguel Lopez had a passionate speech at the Denver City Council meeting that you'll hear at the end with additional comments by Miguel. We have fun no matter what.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 152 XMAS (Tuesday) - McKenna, DanK and Paul the Producer
item.description: Here's our simple Christmas Episode. McKenna, Paul the Producer, and DanK all sat in the studio getting high. We got spontaneous and called our parents to wish them Merry Christmas. Be sure to watch our XMAS VIDEO ON YOUTUBE!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 152 (Tuesday) - Ben Kronberg, Chad from Skunk Magazine and more...
item.description: What a great night. Early on, we were briefly joined by our buddy Tim from John Doe Radio to talk about the Colorado Medical Marijuana Stakeholders meeting this past weekend. Next up we were joined by our funny friend, Ben Kronberg. Later on, Chad from Skunk Magazine came on to talk about his very interesting observations about Medical Marijuana in Colorado. We also gave away stash hats to listeners and studio guests who correctly answered McKenna's Xmas Trivia questions. Near the end our new friend Brittany aka MHT Feb2010 came on the mic to say hello. If we do say so, this was a damn good show. Check the site on Xmas for a special show just for you guys!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 151 (Tuesday) - Brittany Miss High Times and Steve Bloom
item.description: We had a fun night. Early on we brought our friend Spencer on the radio who for a brief moment rapped freestyle. Then we welcomed Brittany, Miss High Times February 2010 in studio. Paul the Producer dove a little off the cliff of Howard Stern talking to Brittany. Between McKenna and Brittany, we had two Miss High Times ladies on the radio. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom joined us to deliver a fun celebrity scoop. Local Activist Miguel Lopez came on to say hello and talk about his Marijuana Protest to the General Assembly coming up. This was an energetic and fun episode. Please, help spread the word of the show and enjoy!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 150 (Tuesday) - Deborah from The Healing Center
item.description: Tonight we had our 150th LIVE show. There were no special celebrations, but still lots of fun and laughs. Early on, Paul the Producer went on one of his tirades about Senator Romer's proposed regulation in the Colorado Medical Marijuana Industry. A bit later, our good friend Deborah from The Healing Center came on to tell us some about their tribulations and experience running a dispensary. Stick around and you'll get to hear 5 things you didn't know about McKenna. Live listeners who actually bothered to listen got a chance to win a prize! This was a fun one. Please spread the word.

item.description: Listen for the laughs tonight. We started out by saying hello to our friend Steve Bloom from CelebStoner.com. A while after McKenna told some funny stories from her childhood. Bob CrazyBear came on to tell us about the first ever Med MJ Smokeout event they're having.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 145 (Tuesday) - Kieren from Lunatic Radio, Tim from John Doe Radio
item.description: Tonight was our glorious return to the internet airwaves after two weeks of silence. Tune in to hear the scoop why, and enjoy this fresh episode. Early on we got to talk to Tim from John Doe Radio who was in reporting on the Colorado Health Department's Emergency meeting to redefine the word 'caregiver' and throw Colorado's Medical Marijuana Industry into peril. We talked about the fun time we had at our annual Cannaween Halloween party. Later on, Kieren from LunaticRadio.com came on to say hello and bring the loony funny. Please help spread the word of our charming little show.

Alas, this was pornographic marijuana night.

Next up we got MPP.org's Bruce Mirken on the phone for an interesting discussion. Steve Bloom brought the celebrity scoop during Reefer Report. DanK called in from the road to say hello and chime in on Pineapple Express.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 119 (Tuesday) - McKenna in NYC, Miss High Times Jessica, Charles C. Lynch, and Steve Bloom
item.description: Tonight Dick Black sat in for McKenna who was in NYC competing for the Miss High Times Pageant. Early on, McKenna joined us on the phone to talk about winning 2nd place, and for a moment we got to speak to the new MHT, Jessica. Later on Charles C. Lynch came on for a heartfelt talk about his impending sentencing for marijuana distribution. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to tell us about his day at the 420 rally in Boulder. We were briefly joined by the Denver 420 Rally Director Miguel Lopez. We welcomed the guys from Dragon Piss pipe cleaner in the studio to say hello.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 115 (Tuesday) - Rapper Big B, Pakelika, Steve Bloom and Miguel Lopez
item.description: Tonight we got the chance to say hello to rapper Big B and talk about his new album, American Underdog. Toward the end of the conversation we got a surprise hello from KMK's Pakelika. Later on CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to give us the scoop on tinsel town's most notable stoners. Niles jumped on the mic to tell us how Marijuana Radio made out at CHAMPS in Las Vegas. Lastly, Miguel Lopez joined us to promo the upcoming 420 rally. item.title: Marijuana Radio 114 (Tuesday) - THCF Paul Stanford and DJ Slim
item.description: Tonight was unique. We started out talking to DJ Slim about his new music coming out. Shortly after, our sales rep Niles touched base from CHAMPS in Vegas. Later on, The Hemp and Cannabis Foundation's Paul Stanford came on and talked about the most interesting hemp facts. A surprise story came to the show when we heard about our friend being held up at gun point for marijuana. The sad shame is there's no recourse when such a crime takes place. There is a gun toting criminal on the loose, and prohibition makes his capture for this unlikely. The criminal ironically left his phone after the crime and his mother was called and told what he did.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 113 (Tuesday) - Tim from John Doe Radio and Josh from Roots and Harmony
item.description: Tonight we started out the show by hearing and commenting on Glenn Beck's recent interview with MPP's Rob Kampia. There was no shortage of acrimony for Glenn's total disrespect and lack of professionalism. What better place to set the record straight with full truthful latitude than our program? Next up, Tim from John Doe Radio joined us in the studio for a passionate exchange. Later on Josh from Roots and Harmony came on to offer some grow tips. A studio full of revelers once more shows that pot smokers can have a peaceful time and don't deserve shame or legal threats.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 103 (Tuesday) - Dick Black and Steve Bloom
item.description: Tonight we broadcasted our final episode of 2008. Sitting in for DanK who was out on comic duty, Dick Black heartily brought the funny. DanK came on the phone to say hello. Roger the intern and Sam 'Danger' Talent entertained us with a quiz during the show. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to wrap about the year's top stoner celebrities and top celebrity busts. The studio was full of enthusiastic revelers surrounded by Colorado's finest bud.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 102 (Tuesday) - Pre Recorded Holiday Show
item.description: Here's a Christmas treat for our fellow stoners who thought they would miss the show this week. We recorded a wild one that sounds more like the free for all heard in the aftershows. We recap our night seeing Cheech and Chong light up America. We pull a ridiculous prank that wound up being pretty funny. Paul the Producer was baked in this one. Listen for the big time laughs. Be sure to hear it up to the very gay ending(gay meaning happy). Have a safe holiday!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 101 (Tuesday) - SubCool and Paul Sappiano
item.description: On with the show! Tonight we returned with another fun episode. Underground Master Grower Subcool joined us on the phone for his interesting brand of story telling. Next up The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down filmmaker Paul Sappiano came on the phone to say hello and tell us a little about life in the city of angels. Also tune in to hear the interesting cleansing experiment we performed for DetoxLabs.com. DanK, Roger the Intern and Niles all stopped smoking and cleaned out to take a drug test. Listen to hear the results!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 100 (Tuesday) - 100th Episode w/Daddy X, Steve Bloom, Ben Kronberg and more!
item.description: Stronger than ever, tonight we pioneered our own personal milestone by doing the 100th episode of Marijuana Radio. The studio was once again packed with the best bud in the state and folks enjoying the yule tide festivities. Starting out, Rod and Randy did a humorous dark diddle about a love triangle. After that, Kottonmouth King's veteran Daddy X came on the phone to catch up with us. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom said hello and indulged in some celeb gossip for the ages. Enjoy a few clips from past episodes including Adrianne Curry, Tommy Chong and Congressman Barney Frank. Comedian Ben Kronberg called in to say hello from Los Angeles during which Paul and DanK got into a hostile screaming match. Moments later came a surprise that brought the party back to happy happy joy joy! Thank you to everyone who appreciates and helps our program be the best, especially The Big C, Suburban Noize Records and Silverback Music. Please tell your friends.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 99 (Tuesday) - Harvest Cup Winner Jesse and Bobby Black from High Times
item.description: Tonight our studio was the place to be. Packed with revelers and the smell of citrus air, we welcomed this year's Harvest Cup winner Jesse on the microphone. Later on Bobby Black from High Times came on to give us the scoop on this year's Cannabis Cup in Amsterdam. Sam Tallent joined us for the Gary Busey update, and Dick Black came on near the end to say hello. This night may have been the best night ever in terms of weed variety in the studio. Pack a bowl and listen to this packed show!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 97 (Tuesday) - Travis Harvest Cup Placement Winner
item.description: Tonight's show can be described as great and having moments that were over the top. The studio once again felt like the cultural epicenter of the movement. We were joined early on by Travis, the master grower who placed 2nd and 3rd in the Harvest Cup for his two strains Pisan Purple Passion and Tangerine. Sam Tallent brought some funny updating us on Gary Busey. The rest of the show we talked about our fun weekend at the Safer's Marijuana Boot Camp and the Harvest Cup.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 96 (Tuesday) - High Society, Danny Danko and Mike Carroll
item.description: Pack your bowls for this extra long episode. We started out the night by saying hello to Erik and Stephanie from the stoner flick High Society. Next up we said hello to Mike Carroll, a medical marijuana patient with an amazing story. Later on High Times Senior Cultivation Editor Danny Danko came on the phone to keep us company. Sam Tallent joined us for a bit on the microphone to talk about Celebrity Rehab and Gary Busey. Derek from North Colorado Green Cross also came on the mic and said hello to tell us about the Medical Marijuana Harvest Cup at the Mishawaka. The studio was packed with revelers and hazy with a most lovely smell.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 95 (Tuesday) - Election Day!
item.description: This very special show features a political race between McKenna, DanK and Paul the Producer for President of the station. This show features a debate between these three and their respective running mates, Dick Black, Niles and Jesse! You must tune in to see who won. In perhaps our longest ever radio offering, local activist Tiny cam on the phone to say hello and update us on his political aspirations. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to give us the celebrity gossip. Greg from Front Range Norml also joined us to promote the amazing cannabis cup coming up. Thinking we'd wind up alone for the night, we wound up instead having a studio full of election day revelers. They helped to produce a skunky smell in the studio. There was a very special preshow that was lost because the computer crashed. However, fret not, the regular show may be the longest we've ever done, and should give you the Marijuana Radio fix that you're looking for.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 93 (Tuesday) - Medicine Man and The Blunted Ones Crew
item.description: Tonight Medicine Man and the Blunted Ones Crew joined us in the studio for some peaceful disobedient fun. One of the Blunted Ones Crew actually puked after trying to endure our warrior studio bong, Chester Molester. But who in their right mind packed it with schwag? Conversely Medicine Man brought some of the greatest ganja in Denver. We discussed Sarah Palin in a rather vulgar manner and we enjoyed good ganja music! Twas Marijuana Radio it was!
item.itunes:author: PVS
item.itunes:summary: Tonight Medicine Man and the Blunted Ones Crew joined us in the studio for some peaceful disobedient fun. One of the Blunted Ones Crew actually puked after trying to endure our warrior studio bong, Chester Molester. But who in their right mind packed it with schwag? Conversely Medicine Man brought some of the greatest ganja in Denver. We discussed Sarah Palin in a rather vulgar manner and we enjoyed good ganja music! Twas Marijuana Radio it was!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 92 (Tuesday) - Pakelika and Brian Vicente
item.description: Once again we made it through another memorable night. First up we were joined in studio by Brian Vicente from Sensible Colorado to tell us about their activist boot camp coming up. DanK returned just in time to enjoy Pakelika on the phone. The masked pot smoker came on to promote his new album and unique candidacy for president. Steve Bloom joined us on the phone to bring the celebrity gossip. We also talked about poop tonight. Where else will you find such flexibility in your counter culture entertainment? Alas, Marijuana Radio carries on in stride.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 91 (Tuesday) - Tommy Chong & Eddy Lepp
item.description: We marched through another winner tonight. With Dick Black filling in once again for DanK, we started out and said hello to Eddy Lepp who will be sentenced to prison December 1st. Please write his judge and ask for leniency. Then the one and only Tommy Chong came on and brought the funny. Local Activist Miguel Lopez was in the studio to talk about his experience with a local cop. Near the end Greg from Norml Front Range joined us on the mic to tell us about his special event coming up. This show rocked.

Later we were joined in the studio by Jon and Jean from the Fork Improv Crew and learned that McKenna has a natural ability. Dick Black sat in for Brent tonight and brought the funny. The regular show segments are there and will guarantee you the full radio experience. Paypal will not allow us to accept donations for VIP Subscription so please consider signing up using regular mail. We really appreciate your support.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 89 (Tuesday) - Steve Binder, Steve Bloom, Rob Corry and Mamakind
item.description: Tune into this stimulating episode as we first welcome the Associate Producer of Totally Baked, Steve Binder. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to liven up the Reefer Report. Lastly Mamakind from Skunk Magazine came on to keep us company.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 88 (Tuesday) - Barry Cooper, Comedian Chris Porter, Sarah Diesel, Dr. David Allen
item.description: Tonight we returned with a show packed to the brim. Dick Black sat in with the rest of us to hear good advice from former police officer Barry Cooperabout how to not get busted! Next comedian Chris Porter of Last Comic Standing came on to say hello. Lovely budtender Sarah Diesel endeared us with her voice and told us about Oaksterdam University! Lastly, Dr. David Allen came on to talk to us about marinol. ALL CURRENT VIP users get a free 2009 MJR calendar! Donate any amount and you will get a free calendar along with your vip subscription.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 87 (Tuesday) - John E. Necro from OPM
item.description: For one more night we fought the weed fight and welcomed John E. Necro from OPM to talk to us about their new album. Later on we went through a list of numbers trying to find a pot user to give a Gravity Vortex bong. One mouthy lady was kind of rude to McKenna which made for a unique moment. Stick around through the Reefer Report for some worthy laughs. The VIP Aftershow was off the wall.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 86 (Tuesday) - Richard Eastman and Steve Bloom
item.description: We make art that is extreme civil disobedience. Tonight was no exception. The studio filled with our friends to celebrate DanK's birthday and welcome well known activist Richard Eastman to the program. Later on we welcomed Tom, organizer of the 'real' Million Man March to tell us about his cross country trek on foot. Celebstoner's Steve Bloom came on to liven up the Reefer Report. A Paul the Producer Solo Rant will be added to the VIP. Support the show by joining the VIP!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 85 (Tuesday) - Casper from Time 4 Hemp, Gatewood, and more...
item.description: Tonight, Dick Black subbed as cohost for DanK and boy did he bring the laughs. Early on we got to talk to Casper, operator of Time 4 Hemp, and his dynamic friend Gatewood. We also had former prosecutor and health specialist Heather in the studio for what was a very interesting conversation. We rolled through the Reefer Report, and then came back for a historic VIP encore aftershow in which we laughed our silly stoned heads off. The VIP Smoke Room is so worth it.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 84 (Tuesday) - Congressman Barney Frank, Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos
item.description: Tonight we honored to welcome Congressman Barney Frank to the program for an interesting discussion. Later on Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos came on to chat things up. Ken from Dragon By JW also came on to say hello before we all meet up for the Hempfest in Seattle this coming weekend. Local activist Tiny came on to talk about his growing interest in public service. All the stars were aligned and came together for this episode. Please spread the word of the show.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 83 (Tuesday) - Tokin' Tam Marijuana Music Awards, Steve Bloom and Chuck Roy!
item.description: Will we do bong hits forever? Maybe, and tonight was no exception. Marijuana Music Awards Tokin' Tam cam on to say hello all the way from the outback. Later on CelebStoner's main man Steve Bloom came on to say hello and give us a celebrity update. We were then joined by local comedian Chuck Roy on the microphone to talk about what he does for alternative energy. Jeremy was in the studio for the event update to tell us about the THC National Convention.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 82 (Tuesday) - HempIceCream.com, Hempfest Organizer Vivian McPeak, Garden Party Director Jason Freeland
item.description: One more week means one more show, and this week we had some wonderful guests from HempIScream.com in the studio to sample some yummy treats. After that we welcomed Hempfest organizer Vivian McPeak on the phone for a stimulating conversation. Later, filmmaker Jason Freeland came on to tell us about his independent film, Garden Party. The Reefer Report was packed with interesting news. The new website is here! Stay tuned for a new video very soon!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 81 (Tuesday) - Doug Benson & Ngaio
item.description: From the Mile High City, tonight we finally got the chance to talk with Super High Me Star, Comedian Doug Benson. Later on, we were joined by Ngaio, well known comedian and editor of West Coast Cannabis, during which Paul the Producer got in an overheated exchange with DanK about the old republican nominee for president. The night was still fun and we all wound up lovingly high. Live listeners got a treat with the aftershow, which will only be heard by the few special listeners who decide to become vip. The stars were aligned and the bong was ripped all night long.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 79 (Tuesday) - Bruce Mirken MPP.org and Kara from Girls Gone Weed
item.description: Forging ahead through one more night, Bruce Mirken from MPP.org came on our phone for a thought provoking discussion. After that, Paul the Producer got on a soapbox for a bit about the topic of responsible drug use. Things got more fun after Girls Gone Weed's Kara came on the phone to say hello. The new show is well underway and in upcoming weeks you'll see the new website debut, and along with it the new 'VIP Smoke Room.' Tell your friends about Marijuana Radio.
item.itunes:author: PVS

item.title: Marijuana Radio 78 (Tuesday) - Bobby Black, Apothecary Angel, The 'NEW' Marijuana Radio, Comedy AfterShow!
item.description: We peacefully fight the drug war, and tonight was no exception. Culture thrives in our studio with our local guests enjoying the unique freedom we bring to Denver. Tonight was the perfect night to unleash a treasure trove of new sounds to present the 'new' show. Bobby Black came on the program to say hello and congratulate McKenna who if you haven't heard yet was named Miss High Times August 2008. Judi, well known as The Apothecary Angel added some sweetness to the evening. After the radio show, our guests enjoyed a very lively comedy session from DanK, Roger the Intern, and the one and only Dick Black. The recording is sure to make it into the VIP Smoke Room coming soon! In coming weeks, check back to see a brand new website.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 77 (Tuesday) - McKenna is Miss High TImes! & Grandpa J
item.description: Roll one up and enjoy another show. Tonight we welcomed myspace artist Grandpa J to the program, and listener Andrew from our forums. All night long McKenna came back to the sobering topic of marijuana law in different places. Tune in to hear us announce that McKenna is MISS HIGH TIMES for August 2008! Thank you to High Times! Congratulations McKenna! The Marijuana News and the Celebrity Stoner update were groovy. Next week the 'new' Marijuana Radio debuts! Tune in to hear!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 76 (Tuesday) - High Times' Vaporella and Hemp Beach TV
item.description: Tonight like clockwork we brought the good times again. The show starts with DanK calling in from Comedy Works where he was trying out for HBO's Def Comedy Jam. Shortly after, High Times' Vaporella came to keep us company with a warm chat. Later on, the guys from Hemp Beach TV said hello. Lastly, stay tuned for a treat to hear Roger the Intern hit off of a 7 foot bong brought in by Spence and his buddies. This piece was easily the biggest we ever had in our studio.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 75 (Tuesday) - Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos, Lawyer Rob Corey, and Steve Bloom
item.description: Tonight the good times continued to 'roll.' A special local group of stoners got to enjoy the evening in our studio during our bake sale. Of course all pastries were thc free. The show started out with Lawyer Rob Corey coming on to tell us not how to get busted with the police. After that the studio guests blazed with laughter when McKenna pretended to be DanK's mom and called a hotline about how to cure 'marijuana addiction.' Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos came on and brought good times. CelebStoner's Steve Bloom came on to round out the Celebrity Stoner Update, and near the end of the show, DanK tried out Happy Chief on a water pipe. The stars were aligned for this one. Behold the most interesting story in podcasting.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 73 (Tuesday) - Dr. Mitch, Pnuckle, Patrick and more...
item.description: Pot lovers, enjoy another thought provoking and silly show. Tonight we got down to business with adults and how to handle children with the topic of marijuana. High Times' columnist Dr. Mitch came on to share his rich perspective. Patrick from 8 Earth Records came on the phone to promote Moon Boot Posse's upcoming concert in Denver. They open up for Pnuckle, who also graced us with an in studio appearance this evening. We rolled through the Celebrity Stoner Update and Marijuana News like old pros. Stick around until the end and hear the most vivid water bubbling from our beautiful water pipe donated by BlownSmokeShop.com.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 72 (Tuesday) - Bobby Black in MJR, Steve Bloom, Brett Apothecary Travel, and Chris Wayne
item.description: The listener buzz is that Marijuana Radio is gonna 'blow up.' For yesterday's show, we had unique open studio event as we hosted High Times' own Bobby Black for a Press Conference to promote his cross country trek raising awareness with NORML. A bevy of local activists showed up to make this a memorable event. Adding to the flavor, Leah's Heavenly Bodies filled the room with sexy beauty. Steve Bloom came on to warm up the Celebrity Stoner Update and share a warm exchange with his former High Times colleague, Bobby. A bit later, Brett from Apothecary Travel came on the phone to say hello. Rounding out the show, Producer Chris Wayne from Kush The Movie came on to tell us about this special indie film.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 69 (Tuesday) - Adrianne Curry, Tiny, and Steve Bloom
item.description: Charging headlong into the world of Celebrity Stonerdom, tonight we had the pleasure of welcoming My Fair Brady, and America's Top Model winner Adrianne Curry to the phone for a warm and funny conversation. Later on, Tiny, organizer of the Denver Global Marijuana March, came in to promote it coming up on Saturday. Roger the Intern delivered a funny and memorable version of the Celebrity Stoner Update, and a while after, Steve Bloom came on to properly gossip about famous people in the news. item.title: Marijuana Radio 68 (Tuesday) - Lawyer Rob Corry, Former High Times Editor Steve Bloom
item.description: Post 420, you can always count on Marijuana Radio to have more good times. Toke a fat one and tune into this episode to hear us talk about our experience over the 420 weekend. First, enjoy a great in studio conversation with Lawyer Rob Corry who helped to secure the permit for the 420 rally in Denver. Later on we played our interview with former High Times Editor, Steve Bloom. Listen to hear if you won the 420 contest! Also, the Marijuana News and CSU rounded out this splendid show. Did you hear the after show? Awe! Well then, guess you better start listening live!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 67 (Tuesday) - Mason Tvert, Richter from Kottonmouth Kings, CUNORML, and OutGrowBigBro
item.description: Packed full of anticipation for 420, McKenna was out of the studio in San Francisco, but called in to say hello. Tonight we welcomed Mason Tvert, Denver's bold local trailblazer from SaferChoice.org for a great conversation. Next up the one and only Richter from Kottonmouth Kings came on the phone line to say hello and talk to us about the new KMK album that dropped the same day. Summer from CUNORML came down to say hello and promote the 420 event at CU Boulder. Hector from OutGrowBigBro came on towards the end to round out this full show. Join us with bud for good times!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 66 (Tuesday) - Mckenna's B-Day, Chuck Roy, The Red Fox, Ill-e-gal and more...
item.description: We like to try different things, and tonight was no exception. Tune in to enjoy McKenna's Birthday Bake Sale Celebration. Folks came to the studio and enjoyed the show while tasting delicious yummy pastries. Comedian Chuck Roy stopped by personally to keep us company. The Red Fox and Ill-e-gal came on the phone for a stoney good time. The Marijuana News and Celebrity Stoner Update were stellar as usual. After, we tried something entirely different when Denver comics turned our live room into a stage to perform. In order to proliferate freedom, one has to make it a stellar culture first. Here it is. Smoke up this culture.

Smoke up this culture.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 65 (Tuesday) - April Fools Day Comedy Special
item.description: You've been waiting, here it is, the April Fools Day Comedy Special! Listen in as we welcomed four local comedians in our studio! First up, Jordan Zuckerman sat down and said hi. A Tom Green looking Andrew Smyczek then came into the studio for a nice greeting. Deacon Dave was here, and the night was rounded out with one of our favorite regulars, Dick Black. We also blasted through the Marijuana News and Celebrity Stoner Update like pros. Returning with might this week, this is a full program you're not gonna want to miss.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 63 (Tuesday) - Miss High Times 2008
item.description:
Tonight one more for the show that keeps bringing the goods. We enjoyed a special treat by welcoming Aum to the program, or as you all know her, Miss High Times 2008. Later on Randy the Glass Blower came on the phone to keep us company. The Activism News and Celebrity Stoner Update were filled to the brim with stories. DanK had to leave early to do a comedy show, which left McKenna, Roger the Intern, and Paul the Producer to get wild and personal during the aftershow. The aftershow is not your typical Marijuana Radio, in fact, it's basically a free for all and many of our regular listeners are getting a kick out of it. Show you're a part of the phenomenon by joining the community forums!

NEW CONTEST! Donate to the Marijuana Radio 420 Collection fund and you could win an awesome prize pack!
item.itunes:author: PVS

item.title: Marijuana Radio 62 (Tuesday) - Ralphie May, DGAF, and more!
item.description: We survived another night as media trailblazers by welcoming well known Comedian Ralphie May on the program for a great conversation. That's not enough? We were joined by Sub Noize artists Chucky Chuck and Gillies from DGAF who came on to talk about their new album. The show was rounded out by the Activism News and Celebrity Stoner Update. We rampaged through a stellar aftershow. We opened up the phone which rang off the hook with many listeners. Dan-K wound up calling a lawyer on the air for legal advise, during which we were like wild animals on hold. Regulars from the forum called up, fans of DGAF, and then the one and only Saint Dog of KMK fame called us up to say hi. The after show is full of listeners hitting the bong. Register for the forums and be part of the growing Marijuana Radio community phenomenon!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 60 (Tuesday) - Miguel Lopez, DJ Slim, Pride City Purpose, Slightly Stoopid, (Hed) pe
item.description: One more time we packed an episode full of fun. We welcomed special guest Miguel Lopez to the studio. Miguel is the organizer of the first ever permitted 420 event in Denver. Later on, DJ slim from Puff Pass Records Came on the phone. Then we said hello to the guys from Pride City Purpose. That's not all! Tune in to hear special interview recordings from Slightly Stoopid's drummer Ryan, and then more from Jared of (Hed) pe who recently opened up to us at their concert. The Activism News and Celebrity Stoner Update entertained dozens of live listeners. After the show we smoked our new custom water pipe courtesy of BongIn.com. The marijuana we smoked was the most powerful in the history of the universe.....well, maybe. Join the growing forum community and speak your mind!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 59 (Tuesday) - Brother Love and Christine Goulden
item.description: Feeling lonely? Tune into Marijuana Radio for a little 'love' for Valentines day. Charismatic musician Brother Love came on the phone and made us all smile. Later on filmmaker Christine Goulden came on to talk about her upcoming documentary 420film. We navigated through the activism news and celebrity stoner update with good stories and laughs. Dan-k was ARRESTED! Tune in to hear the scoop! Join the growing forum community and express your opinion!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 58 (Tuesday) - Jason King of Cannabible - Casey Rasta Bike Winner
item.description: Despite a failing stream due to Comcast loserness, we managed to plop out another fun show. Out of the gates we rocked the Activism News. Obama for President, anyone? Later on we welcomed Rasta Bike winner Casey on the phone to say hello. We topped it all of by a phone visit from Jason King, photographer behind the popular Cannabible books. There was the Celebrity Stoner Update, and tons of 'irresponsible' dialogue. This is the breakthrough crew.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 57 (Tuesday) - Tommy Chong IN STUDIO and more...
item.description: Tune in for a very interesting night and a very full show. We jump off the starting line fast with a new segment called Activism News. After that, enjoy the one and only Tommy Chong who stopped by our studios for a very personal and deep discussion. All the regular earmarks are there, and near the end, we got a special surprise from a call in listener who is a phenomenal beat boxer. We were blown away by his talent. Check out our short film released today, Marijuana Back in Time. It is our greatest work to date. Please spread the word of our charming media outlet like wildfire.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 56 (Tuesday) - Charles Thomas and more...
item.description: Chalk up one more for our short characteristic history. Tonight, the crew dove head first into the show by welcoming Charles Thomas, Executive Director of the Interfaith Drug Policy Project. Later on Shawn from Hempzels.com came on and talked about his products and hemp's vast array of uses. We had a spirited Celebrity Stoner Update that included a batch of our favorite celebrity life mayhem. Register for the forum community to see all the stuff you're missing!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 54 (Tuesday) - Dr. Mitch and KMKween Pamela
item.description: Join us for a strong show that started off the show in 2008. Tonight we officially named Mckenna our new host who will be taking over the hosting reigns of the show in coming weeks. High Times writer Dr. Mitch Earleywine came on the phone for what was a great conversation. Later on, Kottonmouth Kween Pamela came on to give a warm hello. We named our Rasta Bike winner, and enjoyed a revamped Celebrity Stoner Update. If you love us or hate us, you should tell us on our forums! Register now!

item.title: Marijuana Radio SPECIAL (Tuesday) - XMAS Comedy Special
item.description: Tis the season to be funny, so here's a special radio show that we're sure will make you laugh. Mckenna, Dan-K, and Paul the Producer were joined on the mic by three singular Denver comedians. Ben Kronberg, Sam Tallent and Dick Black brought fine wit and good laughs to the first ever Christmas Comedy Special. There was not the smell of pine trees, but the air wreaked properly to make this vintage Marijuana Radio. Stay tuned! 2008 shall be a supreme year of creative curveballs. Happy Holidays, everybody.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 53 (Tuesday) - Pakelika
item.description: Changing times require tough decisions, and tonight, Kottonmouth Kings member Pakelika came on our airwaves to talk about his campaign to become President of the United States. Pakelika spoke openly, and to be quite frank, articulated easily recognizable truths in a way that traditional politicians are completely unable to. This was a fun conversation with some deep thought and a bit of humor. Later on, our faithful longtime listener Kari came on the phone for what was also an interesting conversation. Tune in to hear her say, 'Daddy, wanna get high?' Mckenna sat in to feminize the mix and did a lovely job. Pak for Prez!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 52 (Tuesday) - Rick Steves
item.description: Tonight's show wound up great. The first part of the show was a nice dialogue with world traveler Rick Steves coming on the phone. Then Dan-k joined us to warm up the show. We declared the Build a Pipe winner, Kari. We also reviewed some lovely bongs by a Czech company called BongIn.com. Listen to hear Dan-K cough up a lung from trying one of these beautiful devices. Joanna, with a lovely soft voice, sat in and helped feminize the mix.

item.title: Marijuana Radio 51 (Tuesday) - Tommy Chong and Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos
item.description: Alive and well, tonight's show started off with cultural icon Tommy Chong joining us for a phone interview. It was a really great discussion. After that, Ponyboy from Los Marijuanos showed up on the phone with his unique personality. Lastly, Joseph Pietri, author of The King of Nepal, came on the phone and had lots to say! We read our list of finalists for the 'Build A Pipe' Contest. Vote for your favorite entry!

item.title: Marijuana Radio 50 (Tuesday) - James Masters and Keith Stroup
item.description: It's with great sadness that I regret to inform all of our listeners that Holly G will no longer be the host of Marijuana Radio. We will miss Holly and wish her the best with whatever she does. I am very devoted to the show and plan to continue pushing myself to make amazing new radio and tv in the new year. For a while I will be carrying the program myself until I can find a new female host. We had a strong program. James Masters came on to talk about he and his wife Lisa's victory to receive all their confiscated items back from the police. Later on, Norml head Keith Stroup came on the phone for a very thought provoking conversation.
item.itunes:author: PVS
